trans-unit.source: You must create a load-balanced endpoint for each VM hosting an Azure replica.
trans-unit.target: You must create a load-balanced endpoint for each VM hosting an Azure replica.

trans-unit.source: If you have replicas in multiple regions, each replica for that region must be in the same cloud service in the same VNet.
trans-unit.target: If you have replicas in multiple regions, each replica for that region must be in the same cloud service in the same VNet.

trans-unit.source: Creating Availability Group replicas that span multiple Azure regions requires configuring multiple VNets.
trans-unit.target: Creating Availability Group replicas that span multiple Azure regions requires configuring multiple VNets.

trans-unit.source: For more information on configuring cross VNet connectivity, see [Configure VNet to VNet Connectivity](../articles/vpn-gateway/virtual-networks-configure-vnet-to-vnet-connection.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on configuring cross VNet connectivity, see [Configure VNet to VNet Connectivity](../articles/vpn-gateway/virtual-networks-configure-vnet-to-vnet-connection.md).

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, navigate to each VM hosting a replica and view the details.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, navigate to each VM hosting a replica and view the details.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Endpoints** tab for each of the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Endpoints** tab for each of the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the **Name** and **Public Port** of the listener endpoint you want to use is not already in use.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the **Name** and **Public Port** of the listener endpoint you want to use is not already in use.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the name is “MyEndpoint” and the port is “1433”.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the name is “MyEndpoint” and the port is “1433”.

trans-unit.source: On your local client, download and install [the latest PowerShell module](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).
trans-unit.target: On your local client, download and install [the latest PowerShell module](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).

trans-unit.source: A new PowerShell session is opened with the Azure administrative modules loaded.
trans-unit.target: A new PowerShell session is opened with the Azure administrative modules loaded.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet directs you to a browser to download a publish settings file to a local directory.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet directs you to a browser to download a publish settings file to a local directory.

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted for your log-in credentials for your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted for your log-in credentials for your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Run the **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** command with the path of the publish settings file that you downloaded:
trans-unit.target: Run the **Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile** command with the path of the publish settings file that you downloaded:

trans-unit.source: Once the publish settings file is imported, you can manage your Azure subscription in the PowerShell session.
trans-unit.target: Once the publish settings file is imported, you can manage your Azure subscription in the PowerShell session.
